==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あし|こ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=あしこ}}. Appears to be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=あしこ|彼|tr1=a|t1=that one over there|pos1=distal marker, indicating something distant from both speaker and listener|し|tr2=shi|pos2=unknown, possibly a possessive|処|tr3=ko|t3=place}}. May be the older form of modern ''asoko'' below.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あしこ|acc=0}}

====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|あしこ|pronoun}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あしこ|obsolete}} [[yon]] place, that place [[yonder]], that place over there, that area over there, that part over there
#* {{RQ:Genji Monogatari}}
#*: {{ja-usex|'''彼処'''に籠りなむのち|'''あしこ''' に こもりなむ のち|...after hiding '''there'''...}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|あそ|こ}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''ashiko'' above,<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> probably influenced by {{m|ja|そこ|tr=soko}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|あそこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}
====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|あそこ|pronoun}}

# [[yon]] place, that place [[yonder]], that place over there, that area over there, that part over there

=====See also=====
{{Japanese demonstratives}}

=====Usage notes=====
The reading ''asoko'' is the most commonly used in modern Japanese.

The hiragana spelling {{ja-l|あそこ}} is almost always used. The kanji use is rare.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あ|こ}}
Appears to be a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=あこ|彼|tr1=a|t1=that one over there|pos1=distal marker, indicating something distant from both speaker and listener|処|tr2=ko|t2=place}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> First appears in the late 1500s, early 1600s,<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> and used mostly in the [[w:Kansai region|Kansai region]].<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> Given the historical tendency for innovation in the Kansai region, the term may instead derive as an abbreviation of ''asoko'' above, by analogy with the ''-ko'' suffix in {{m|ja|ここ|tr=koko||here}} and {{m|ja|そこ|tr=soko||there|pos=closer to the listener than to the speaker}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あこ|acc=1}}

====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|あこ|pronoun}}

# [[yon]] place, that place [[yonder]], that place over there, that area over there, that part over there

=====Usage notes=====
Generally only used in the [[w:Kansai region|Kansai region]].

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あす|こ}}
Shift in pronunciation from ''asoko'' above.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|あすこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=あすこ|rare}} [[yon]] place, that place [[yonder]], that place over there, that area over there, that part over there

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|か|こ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かこ|彼|tr1=ka|pos1=distal marker, indicating something distant from both speaker and listener|t1=that one over there|処|tr2=ko|t2=place}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かこ}}

====Pronoun====
{{ja-pos|かこ|pronoun}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かこ|rare|obsolete}} [[yon]] place, that place [[yonder]], that place over there, that area over there, that part over there
#* '''1483''', {{lang|ja|地蔵菩薩霊験絵詞}} (''Jizō Bosatsu Reiken Eshi'', “Jizō Bodhisattva Miracle Picture-scroll”)
#*: {{ja-usex|'''彼処'''を退き去る也|'''かこ''' を そきさる なり|...[he] left '''that place'''...}}
